newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Smedvig off after NYSE debut.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Smedvig off after NYSE debut.

text.p: Shares of Norway's Smedvig ASA slipped in very heavy trading after the offshore drilling company made its $170 million market debut on the New York Stock Exchange on Friday.
The shares were trading off 3/8 to 20-7/8 at midday. Smedvig was one of the most active issues on the NYSE.
The company offered seven of the eight million class B shares on the NYSE as American Depositary receipts. The Smedvig family holding company, Summa As, offered one million.
Morgan Stanley was the lead underwriter of the deal.
Other companies that made their market debuts on Friday:
-- Information Management Resources Inc shares rose to 15-5/8 from their IPO price of $14, above the company's initial estimated pricing range of $11 to $13.
The company provides outsourcing software for information technology departments.
-- IA Corp shares rose 3/8 to 6-3/8 after the 2.525 million share-IPO. Shares of the Emeryville, California company were priced at $6, well below its initial estimated pricing range of $9 to $11.
